column4: what command does one use to find out which package owns a certain file on a system?
i'm not sure... i guess files in /etc/default may get created by the postinst script. i guess the package that's actually responsible for that file is console-setup anyway
yes it is... thank you again... i just backed up the file and ran reconfigure (see my msg above)
you do need to use "ar", since a .deb is an ar archive
crap! system does not have ar :( any other way? does any other common program extract ar archives?
i don't know, honestly i doubt it somehow...
do you know if debootstrap requires ar?
the package debootstrap has "binutils" as a dependency, and binutils is the package that provides /usr/bin/ar
what're you trying to do? can't you for instance just obtain a binary copy of ar?
doing the "impossible" - installing linux (ubuntu) on a computer without monitor, keyboard, mouse, internet, usb, etc. :D
well, from the opposite perspective - what do you *have*?
ill just "cheat" and use ar from the connected computer :P - thats the only thing that i have, a bootable cd (without dpkg or ar - hah!) and this computer connected to it
thank you for your help and suggestions
i somehow missed your answer and just read: "<LjL> i suspect he was thinking" and thought to my self, "i sure hope he was thinking!" ;)
well, that wasn't what i meant, but you shouldn't take that sort of thing for granted anyway ;P
